intro: Galium trachyspermum var. gracilens, commonly known as slender woodruff, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trailing or ascending growth habit. The plant features small, white or pale green flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks.
